1.description: You have no idea how hard it is to get a nice picture of the four of us.

brothers3.description: We haven't told Felix that Santa is watching, but he was extra good anyway.
brothers3.title: Brothers 3

brothers4.description: Felix shares our excitement at witnessing Milo's milestones. He likes to help his little brother roll over, while cheering him on.
brothers4.title: Brothers 4

nana.description: Milo's always full of holiday cheer, whether or not it's actually a holiday.
nana.title: Nana

presents1.description: Felix, bless his unmaterialistic heart, was expecting exactly one present:   a spaceship, from Papa Noel.  He got that and much more, helped by friends and family all over the world.  We're not sure why, but as we opened it he snuggled into Dean's arms and said he was a "little scared".
presents1.title: Presents 1

presents2.description: The boys check out the space ship.  It's a Star Wars Millenium Falcon, very much like a toy that Dean grew up with.
presents2.title: Presents 2

presents3.description: Milo, true to the stereotype, likes the wrapping paper as much as what's inside.
presents3.title: Presents 3

presents4.description: Lucie got this spinning thing for Milo, and he is indeed fascinated.
presents4.title: Presents 4

skates.description: Felix tries out his new skates.
skates.title: Skates

spaceducks.description: Felix decides his spaceship is designed to carry ducks.
spaceducks.title: Spaceducks

description:
Merry Christmas!

We had a great Christmas, for which we are truly thankful. The last few had fallen short of our usual experience of holiday joy:
• 2003: we were at Church St. and the family had a horrible flu.
• 2002: we were in France and Felix had horrible jet lag.
• 2001: we were at Holly Park, Felix had just been born, and was having problems feeding.
• 2000: Lucie had just miscarried, and we were feeling pretty down.

This year, however, everyone was healthy, noone was jet-lagged, we were rejoicing in a new family member, and everyone knew how to eat. It was a comfy, cozy at-home celebration with Nana, filled with good food and home-baked madeleines.

Milo is sitting unassisted -- though he's not nearly as into it as Felix was at the same age. Also, he is getting better at rolling from his belly to his back; and he is even starting to crawl commando-style very very slightly. We hesistate to mark it as "first crawl", but at least it's some sort of self-propulsion.
title: December 26
